climbs.name: Spike Jones and the City Slickers

content.description: Spike Jones and the City Slickers follow the angling line of corner up an left from the Central Hub.  The first two steep sections are part of Liberal Dogma but the Spike Jones route follows the corner right on up through the steep overhanging diherderals to a flat summit top of the left tower and next to the marble tower.
content.location: The Spike Jones and the City Slickers route begins at the Central Hub heading left and up and share the initial pathway of Liberal Dogma until an overhanging corner bulge.

content.description: The Republican Way obviously is an exit to the right to get off the Center Wall by going into a side gully with little change in elevation but some slippery slopes and obstacles make the exit less pleasing than it looked from the start.  The traverse could be done either way but the fixed protection is better placed for an exit from the center rightward.  The route is better done as 2 pitches or climb in tandem to reduce rope drag.
content.protection: There are about 10 bolts located before each difficult section.
content.location: The route leaves from the lower third of the central line, Chase Way and goes right into a side gulley.  There are two ways out of the gulley-- left if up a slab and the right goes under a mild overhang.

content.description: Liberal Dogma leaves the Central Hub anchors and makes an exit to the left.  This route offers the easiest way off the towers other than rappelling.  The moves left and up from the anchors are hardest on both pitches and  well placed bolt protects these moves.
content.protection: The route has long zones of easy going without bolt protection.
content.location: From the Central Hub exit left and upward.

content.description: Cross Fit Bottle Training is a steep/mild overhanging face on the black amphibolite wall at the base of the Krumblings Towers Center. The rock is solid and mostly big holds but with difficult exits from positions.
content.location: The route begins at the end of the low angle rock at the central base of the Krumbling Towers and is the left one of two that start here.

content.description: The Chase Way follows the low angel banded black and while dike rocks from the top of the black amphibole to the right side of the summit blocks.  This TR route is also a rappel path to the top of amphibolite climbs (steeper).  The climb has some short steep frictions zones and a few dihederals.
content.protection: a TR problem until some one adds bolts to the rock.
content.location: About in the center lower third of the Krumbling Towers is the beginning of the the TR problem.  There are at least two set of anchors bolts at the lower third of the tower just below the black lichen wall near a water seep to end at when rappelling or for belaying.

content.description: Barmore's Brothel is about how you spend your stored energy while on the steep hard line Woody chose. There are a couple of ways to go around a difficult zone using the same bolt as the highest protection below.
content.location: The right route on the black amphibolite rock at the base of the Krumbling Tower
